lines.gurmukhi: 1 vsqU niRdys mMgl mnu`Kw dyh sPl ikvyN hY
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the Grace of the divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: EAMkwir Akwru kir pauxu pwxI bYsMqr Dwry
lines.transliteration_english: Aoankaari Akaaru Kari Paounu Paanee Baisantaru Dhaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Oankar transforming into forms created air, water and fire.

lines.gurmukhi: Driq Akws ivCoiVaunu cMdu sUru duie joiq svwry
lines.transliteration_english: Dharati Akaas Vichhorhianu Chandu Sooru Day Joti Savaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then separating earth and sky He threw two flames of sun and moon in between them.

lines.gurmukhi: KwxI cwir bMDwn kir lK caurwsIh jUin duAwry
lines.transliteration_english: Khaanee Chaari Bandhaan Kari Lakh Chauraaseeh Jooni Duaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Further creating the four mines of life He created eighty four lacs of species and their animalcules.

lines.gurmukhi: ieks ieks jUin ivic jIA jMqu Axgxq Apwry
lines.transliteration_english: Ikas Ikas Jooni Vichi Jeea Jantu Anaganat Apaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: In each species further are born myriads of creatures.

lines.gurmukhi: mwxs jnmu dulMBu hY sPl jnmu gur srix auDwry
lines.transliteration_english: Maanas Janamu Dulabhu Hai Saphal Janamu Gur Sarani Udhaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Among them all, the human birth is the rare one.  One should, in this very Birth, liberate himself by surrendering before the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq gur sbid ilv Bwie Bgiq gur igAwn vIcwry
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Gur Sabadi Liv Bhaai Bhagati Gur Giaan Veechaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: One must go to holy congregation; the consciousness should be merged in the word of the Guru and cultivating only a loving devotion, one should undertake to follow the path shown by the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: praupkwrI gurU ipAwry ]1]
lines.transliteration_english: Paraoupakaaree Guroo Piaaray ?1?

Shabad OS B.translation: The man by becoming altruist becomes beloved of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: 2 inMmRqw

Shabad OS B.translation: Humility

lines.gurmukhi: sBdUM nIvI Driq hY Awpu gvwie hoeI EfIxI
lines.transliteration_english: Sabh Doon Neevee Dharati Hai Aapu Gavaai Hoee Aodeenee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The earth is the most humble which eschewing ego is firm and steady.

lines.gurmukhi: DIrju Drmu sMqoKu diRVu pYrw hyiT rhY ilv lIxI
lines.transliteration_english: Dheeraju Dharamu Santokhu Drirhu Pairaa Haytdi Rahai Liv Leenee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Deeply rooted in fortitude, dharma and contentment it remains tranquil under feet.

lines.gurmukhi: swD jnw dy crx Cuih AwFIxI hoeI lwKIxI
lines.transliteration_english: Saadh Janaan Day Charan Chhuhi Aaddheenee Hoee Laakheenee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Touching the holy feet of the saints, it earlier being worth half a penny now becomes worth lacs.

lines.gurmukhi: AMmiRq bUMd suhwvxI Chbr Clk ryx hoie rIxI
lines.transliteration_english: Anmrit Boond Suhaavanee Chhahabar Chhalak Raynu Hoi Reenee.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the rain of love the earth gets satiated with delight.

lines.gurmukhi: imilAw mwxu inmwxIAY iprm ipAwlw pIie pqIxI
lines.transliteration_english: Miliaa Maanu Nimaaneeai Piram Piaalaa Peei Pateenee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Only the humble get adorned with glory and the earth, quaffing the cup of the love of the Lord gets satiated.

lines.gurmukhi: jo bIjY soeI luxY sB rs ks bhu rMg rMgIxI
lines.transliteration_english: Jo Beejai Soee Lounai Sabh Ras Kas Bahu Rang Rangeenee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Amongst variegated flora, sweet and bitter tastes, and colours on earth, one reaps whatever one sows.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmiK suK Plu hY mskIxI ]2]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Hai Masakeenee ?2?

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukhs (in their humility like the earth) get fruit of delight.

lines.gurmukhi: 3 crnwN dw diRStwNq

Shabad OS B.translation: Example of feet

lines.gurmukhi: mwxs dyh su Kyh hY iqsu ivic jIBY leI nkIbI
lines.transliteration_english: Maanas Dayh Su Khayh Hai Tisu Vichi Jeebhai Laee Nakeebee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Human body is like ashes but in it the tongue is admirable (for its benefits).

lines.gurmukhi: AKI dyKin rUp rMg rwg nwd kMn krin rkIbI
lines.transliteration_english: Akhee Daykhani Roop Rang Raag Naad Kann Karani Rakeebee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The eyes behold forms and colours and the ears take care of the sounds- musical and otherwise.

lines.gurmukhi: nik suvwsu invwsu hY pMjy dUq burI qrqIbI
lines.transliteration_english: Naki Suvaasu Nivaasu Hai Panjay Doot Buree Tarateebee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Nose is the abode of smell and thus all these five couriers (of the body) remain indulged in these pleasures (and become futile).

lines.gurmukhi: sBdUM nIvy crn hoie Awp gvwie nsIb nsIbI
lines.transliteration_english: Sabh Doon Neevay Charan Hoi Aapu Gavaai Naseebu Naseebee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Among these all, the feet are placed at the lowest level and they repudiating ego are fortunate.

lines.gurmukhi: haumY rogu imtwiedw siqgur pUrw krY qbIbI
lines.transliteration_english: Haoumai Rogu Mitaaidaa Satigur Pooraa Karai Tabeebee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru by giving treatment removes the malady of ego.

lines.gurmukhi: pYrI pY rhrwis kir gur isK suix gur isK mnIbI
lines.transliteration_english: Pairee Pai Raharaasi Kari Gur Sikh Souni Gur Sikh Maneebee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true disciples of the Guru touch the feet and bow and abide by the instructions of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: murdw hoie murId grIbI ]3]
lines.transliteration_english: Muradaa Hoi Mareedu Gareebee ?3?

Shabad OS B.translation: He who becomes humble and dead to all desires is the true disciple.

lines.gurmukhi: 4 cIcI AMgulI Awid dw diRStwNq

Shabad OS B.translation: Example of the little finger

lines.gurmukhi: lhuVI hoie cIcuMglI pYDI Cwip imlI vifAweI
lines.transliteration_english: Lahurhee Hoi Cheechoungalee Paidhee Chhaapi Milee Vadiaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The smallest finger is respected and adorned by making it wear the ring.

lines.gurmukhi: lhuVI Gnhr bUMd huie prgtu moqI isp smweI
lines.transliteration_english: Lahurhee Ghanahar Boond Hui Paragatu Motee Sip Samaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The drop from the cloud is small but the same but getting into the mouth of shell becomes pearl.

lines.gurmukhi: lhuVI bUtI kysrY mQY itkw soBw pweI
lines.transliteration_english: Lahurhee Bootee Kaysarai Madai Tikaa Sobhaa Paaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The plant of saffron (Messua ferria) is small one but the same adorns the forehead in the form of consecratory mark.

lines.gurmukhi: lhuVI pwrs pQrI Ast Dwqu kMcn krvweI
lines.transliteration_english: Lahurhee Paaras Padaree Asat Dhaatu Kanchanu Karavaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The  philosopherâ€™s stone is small but transforms alloy of eighty metals into gold.

lines.gurmukhi: ijau mix lhuVy sp isir dyKY luik luik lok lukweI
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Mani Lahurhay Sap Siri Daykhai Louki Louki Lok Loukaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the head of small snake remains the jewel which people behold in wonder.

lines.gurmukhi: jwix rswiexu pwirAhu rqI muil n jie mulweI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaani Rasaainu Paariahu Reet Muli N Jaai Mulaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: From mercury is prepared elixir which is invaluable.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpu gvwie n Awp gxweI ]4]
lines.transliteration_english: Aapu Gavaai N Aapu Ganaaee ?4?

Shabad OS B.translation: Those who eschew  ego never allow themselves to be noticed.

lines.gurmukhi: 5 A`g Aqy jl qoN inMmRqw

Shabad OS B.translation: Humility from fire and water

lines.gurmukhi: Ag qqI jlu sIAlw ikqu Avguix ikqu gux vIcwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Agi Tatee Jalu Seearaa Kitu Avagouni Kitu Goun Veechaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: It is a matter worth pondering as to how fire is hot and water cold.

lines.gurmukhi: AgI DUMAw Daulhr jlu inrml gur igAwn sucwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Agee Dhooaa Dhaulaharu Jalu Niramal Gur Giaan Souchaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The fire soiles the building by its smoke and water cleanses it. This fact requires the guidance of Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: kul dIpku bYsMqrhu jl kul kvl vfy prvwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Kul Deepaku Baisantarahu Jal Kul Kavalu Vaday Paravaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the family and dynasty of fire is lamp, and to water belongs a bigger family of lotus.

lines.gurmukhi: dIpk hyq pqMg dw kvl Bvr prgtu pwhwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Deepak Haytu Patang Daa Kaval Bhavar Paragatu Paahaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: This is well known all over the world that moth loves fire (and gets burnt) and black bee loves lotus (and rests in it).

lines.gurmukhi: AgI lwt aucwt hY isru aucw kir krY kucwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Agee Laat Ouchaat Hai Siru Ouchaa Kari Karai Kouchaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The flame of fire goes up and like an egotist behaves viciously.

lines.gurmukhi: isru nIvw nIvwxu vwsu pwxI AMdir praupkwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Siru Neevaa Neevaani Vaasu Paanee Andari Paraoupakaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Water goes towards low level and has qualities of altruism.

lines.gurmukhi: inv clY so gurU ipAwrw ]5]
lines.transliteration_english: Niv Chalai So Guroo Piaaraa ?5?

Shabad OS B.translation: The Guru loves him who remains humble by nature.

lines.gurmukhi: 6 mjIT-ksuMBy qoN aupdyS

Shabad OS B.translation: Teaching from madder Rubia munjista and safflower-

lines.gurmukhi: rMgu mjIT ksuMB dw kcw pkw ikqu vIcwry
lines.transliteration_english: Rangu Majeetd Kasounbh Daa Kachaa Pakaa Kitu Veechaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Why madder is the fast colour and safflower temporary.

lines.gurmukhi: DrqI auKix kFIAY mUl mjIT jVI jVqwry
lines.transliteration_english: Dharatee Oukhani Kaddheeai Mool Majeetd Jarhee Jarhataaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: The roots of madder spread in earth, it is first brought out and put into the pit and is pounded with wooden pestles.

lines.gurmukhi: auKl muhly kutIAY pIhix pIsY ckI Bwry
lines.transliteration_english: Oukhal Muhalay Kouteeai Peehani Peesai Chakee Bhaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then it is crushed into a heavy mill.

lines.gurmukhi: shY Avtxu Aig dw hoie ipAwrI imlY ipAwry
lines.transliteration_english: Sahai Avatanu Agi Daa Hoi Piaaree Milai Piaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: It further suffers the pain of getting boiled and decorated in water and then only it adorns (with fast colour) the clothes of the beloved.

lines.gurmukhi: pohlIAhu isru kiFkY Pulu ksuMB cluMB iKlwry
lines.transliteration_english: Pohaleeahu Siru Kaddhi Kai Phulu Kasounbh Chalounbh Khilaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: The safflower comes up from the upper portion of the thorny weed Carthamus tinctoria and yields its deep colour.

lines.gurmukhi: Kt qursI dy rMgIAY kpt snyhu rhY idh cwry
lines.transliteration_english: Khat Turasee Day Rangeeai Kapat Sanayhu Rahai Dih Chaaray.

Shabad OS B.translation: Adding tart in it, the clothes are dyed and they remain dyed only for a few days.

lines.gurmukhi: nIvw ijxY aucyrw hwry ]6]
lines.transliteration_english: Neevaa Jinai Ouchayraa Haaray ?6?

Shabad OS B.translation: The lowly born utimately wins and the so-called high up gets defeated.

lines.gurmukhi: 7 kIVI-mkVI Awid

Shabad OS B.translation: Ant, spider etc.-

lines.gurmukhi: kIVI inkVI clq kr BiRMgI no imil BiRMgI hovY
lines.transliteration_english: Keerhee Nikarhee Chalit Kari Bhringee No Mili Bhringee Hovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Small ant becomes bhringi ( a kind of buzzing bee) by keeping company with it.

lines.gurmukhi: inkVI idsY mkVI sUqu muhhu kiF iPir sMgovY
lines.transliteration_english: Nikarhee Disai Makarhee Sootu Muhahu Kaddhi Dhiri Sangovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Apparently, the spider looks to be small but it brings out and  swallows (hundred metres of) yarn.

lines.gurmukhi: inkVI miK vKwxIAY mwiKE imTw BwgTu hovY
lines.transliteration_english: Nikarhee Makhi Vakhaaneeai Maakhiao Mitdaa Bhaagatdu Hovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Honey-bee is small one but its sweet honey is sold by merchants.

lines.gurmukhi: inkVw kIVw AwKIAY pt ptoly kir FMg FovY
lines.transliteration_english: Nikarhaa Keerhaa Aakheeai Pat Patolay Kari Ddhang Ddhauvai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Silk worm is little one but the clothes made by its fibre are worn and offered on the occassions of marriage and other ceremonies.

lines.gurmukhi: gutkw muh ivic pwiekY dys idsMqir jwie KVovY
lines.transliteration_english: Goutakaa Muh Vichi Paai Kai Days Disantari Jaai Kharhovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Yogis putting the small magic ball in their mouth become invisible and go in the far off places undetected.

lines.gurmukhi: moqI mwxk hIirAw pwiqswhu lY hwru provY
lines.transliteration_english: Motee Maanak Heeriaa Paatisaahu Lai Haaru Parovai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Strings of small pearls and gems are worn by kings and emperors.

lines.gurmukhi: pwie smwiexu dhI iblovY ]7]
lines.transliteration_english: Paai Samaainu Dahee Bilovai ?7?

Shabad OS B.translation: Further, the curd is made by mixing a small quantity of rennet into milk (and thus butter is obtained).

lines.gurmukhi: 8 Gwh

Shabad OS B.translation: Grass

lines.gurmukhi: lqwN hyiT lqwVIAY Gwhu n kFY swhu ivcwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Lataan Haytdi Lataarheeai Ghaahu N Kaddhai Saahu Vichaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Grass is trampled under feet yet the poor thing never complains.

lines.gurmukhi: gorsu dy KVu KwiekY gwie grIbI praupkwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Gorasu Day Kharhu Khaai Kai Gaai Gareebee Paraoupakaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The cow while eating grass remains altruist and gives milk to the poor.

lines.gurmukhi: duDhu dhI jmweIAY dhIAhu mKxu Cwih ipAwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Dudhahu Dahee Jamaaeeai Daeeahu Makhanu Chhaahi Piaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: From milk is made curd and then from curd butter and delicious butter-milk etc are prepared.

lines.gurmukhi: iGA qy hovin hom jg FMg suAwrQ cj Acwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Ghia Tay Hovani Hom Jag Ddhang Suaarad Chaj Achaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: With that butter (ghee) homs, yajnas and other social and religious rituals are performed.

lines.gurmukhi: Drm Daulu prgtu hoie DIrij vhY shY isir Bwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Dharam Dhaulu Paragatu Hoi Dheeraji Vahai Sahai Siri Bhaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Dharma in the form of mythological bull patiently bears and burden of the earth.

lines.gurmukhi: ieku ieku jwau jxyidAwN chuckw ivic vg hjwrw
lines.transliteration_english: Iku Iku Jaau Janaydiaan Chahu Chakaa Vichi Vag Hajaaraa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Each calf produces thousands of calves in all lands.

lines.gurmukhi: qiRx AMdir vfw pwswrw ]8]
lines.transliteration_english: Trin Andari Vadaa Paasaaraa ?8?

Shabad OS B.translation: One blade of grass has infinite extension i.e.the humility becomes base of the whole world.

lines.gurmukhi: 9 iql

Shabad OS B.translation: sesame - Sesamum indicum

lines.gurmukhi: lhuVw iqlu hoie jMimAw nIchu nIcu n Awpu gxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Lahurhaa Tilu Hoi Janmiaa Neechahu Neechu N Aapu Ganaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Small sesame seeds sprouted and it remained lowly and got itself not mentioned anywhere.

lines.gurmukhi: Pulw sMgiq visAw hoie inrgMDu sugMD suhwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Phulaa Sangati Vasiaa Hoi Niragandhu Sougandhu Suhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: When it came to the company of flowers, it earlier being devoid of fragrance now become fragrant.

lines.gurmukhi: kolU pwie pIVwieAw hoie Pulylu Kylu vrqwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Koloo Paai Peerhaaiaa Hoi Phulaylu Khaylu Varataaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: When alongwith flowers it was crushed in crusher, it became perfume oil.

lines.gurmukhi: piqqu pivqR cilqR kir piqswh isir Dir suKu pwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Patitu Pavitr Chalitr Kari Patisaah Siri Dhari Soukhu Paaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: God, the purifier of the impure ones, enacted such a wondrous feat that that fragrant oil gave  pleasure to the king when messaged on his head.

lines.gurmukhi: dIvY pwie jlwieAw kul dIpku jig ibrdu sdwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Deevai Paai Jalaaiaa Kul Deepaku Jagi Biradu Sadaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: When it was burnt in the lamp it came to be known as kuldipak, the lamp of the dynasty generally lit to complete the last rites of man.

lines.gurmukhi: kjlu hoAw dIivAhu AKI AMdir jwie smwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Kajalu Hoaa Deeviahu Akhee Andari Jaai Samaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: From lamp becoming collyrium it merged in the eyes.

lines.gurmukhi: bwlw hoie n vfw khwieAw ]9]
lines.transliteration_english: Baalaa Hoi N Vadaa Kahaaiaa ?9?

Shabad OS B.translation: It became great but never allowed itself to be called so.

lines.gurmukhi: 10 vVyvwN

Shabad OS B.translation: Cotton seed

lines.gurmukhi: hoie vVyvwN jg ivic bIjy qnu Kyh nwil rlwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Hoi Varhayvaan Jag Vichi Beejay Tanu Khayh Naali Ralaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The cotton seed got itself mixed with dust.

lines.gurmukhi: bUtI hoie kpwh dI tINfy his his Awp iKVwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Bootee Hoi Kapaah Dee Teenday Hasi Hasi Aapu Khirhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: From that very seed the plant of cotton emerged on which the balls smiled unobstructed.

lines.gurmukhi: duhu imil vylxu vyilAw lUM lUM kir kir quMbu quMbwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Duhu Mili Vaylanu Vayliaa Loo Loo Kari Kari Tounbu Tounbaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The cotton got ginned by the ginning machine and after carding.

lines.gurmukhi: ipM\\\\ix ipM\\\\ aufwieAw kir kir goVI sUq kqwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Pinni Pin Udaaiaa Kari Kari Gorhee Soot Kataaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Making rolls and spinning, the thread was made from it.

lines.gurmukhi: qix vuix KuMib cVwiekY dy dy duKu DuAwie rMgwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Tani Vouni Khounbi Charhaai Kai Day Day Doukhu Dhuaai Rangaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then through its warp and waft it was woven and made to suffer getting dyed in boiling cauldron.

lines.gurmukhi: kYcI ktix kitAw sUeI Dwgy joiV sIvwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Kaichee Katani Katiaa Sooee Dhaagay Jorhi Seevaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The scissors cut it and it was stiched with the help of needle and thread.

lines.gurmukhi: ljxu kjxu hoie kjwieAw ]10]
lines.transliteration_english: Lajanu Kajanu Hoi Kajaaiaa ?10?

Shabad OS B.translation: Thus it became cloth, the means for the covering up of others nudity.

lines.gurmukhi: 11 Anwrdwxw

Shabad OS B.translation: Seed of the sour pomergranate

lines.gurmukhi: dwxw hoie Anwr dw hoie DUiV DUVI ivic DsY
lines.transliteration_english: Daanaa Hoi Anaar Daa Hoi Dhoorhi Dhoorhee Vichi Dhasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The seed of promegranate merges into dust by becoming dust.

lines.gurmukhi: hoie ibrKu hrIAwvlw lwl gulwlw Pul ivgsY
lines.transliteration_english: Hoi Birakhu Hareeaavalaa Laal Gulaalaa Phal Vigasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The same becoming green is adorned by flowers of deep red colour.

lines.gurmukhi: iekqu ibrK shs Pl Pul Pl iekdU iek srsY
lines.transliteration_english: Ikatu Birakh Sahas Phal Phal Phal Ik Doo Ik Sarasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: On tree, thousands of fruits grow, each fruit being more delicious than another.

lines.gurmukhi: iekdU dwxy lK hoie Pl Pl dy mn AMdr vsY
lines.transliteration_english: Ik Doo Daanay Lakh Hoi Phal Phal Day Man Andari Vasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: In each fruit reside thousands of seeds produced by one seed.

lines.gurmukhi: iqsu Pl qoit n AwveI gurmuiK suKu Plu AMmRiq rsY
lines.transliteration_english: Tisu Phal Toti N Aavaee Guramoukhi Soukhu Phalu Anmritu Rasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: As there is no dearth of fruit on that tree so the gurmukh is never at loss to realize the delights of the fruits of nectar.

lines.gurmukhi: ijau ijau lXin qoiV Pil iqau iqau iPir iPir PlIAY hsY
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Jiu Layani Torhi Phali Tiu Tiu Dhiri Dhir Phaleeai Hasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: With the plucking of the fruit the tree again and again, bursting into laughter bears more fruits.

lines.gurmukhi: inv clxu gur mwrgu dsY ]11]
lines.transliteration_english: Niv Chalanu Gur Maaragu Dasai ?11?

Shabad OS B.translation: Thus the great Guru teaches the way of humility.

lines.gurmukhi: 12 Su`D mohr

Shabad OS B.translation: The pure coin

lines.gurmukhi: ryix rswiex isJIAY ryqu hyqu kir kMcnu vsY
lines.transliteration_english: Aani Rasaain Sijheeai Raytu Haytu Kari Kanchanu Vasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The dust of sand in which remains gold mixed is kept in a chemical.

lines.gurmukhi: Doie Doie kxu kFIAY rqI mwsw qolw hsY
lines.transliteration_english: Aai Dhoi Kanu Kaddheeai Ratee Maasaa Tolaa Hasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then after washing the gold particles are taken out of it which weigh from miligrams to grams and more.

lines.gurmukhi: pwie kuTwlI gwlIAY rYxI kir suinAwir ivgsY
lines.transliteration_english: Paai Koutdaalee Gaaleeai Rainee Kari Souniaari Vigasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then put into the crucible it is melted and to the delight of the goldsmith, is converted into lumps.

lines.gurmukhi: GiV GiV pqR pKwlIAin lUxI lwie jlwie rhsY
lines.transliteration_english: Gharhi Gharhi Patr Pakhaaleeani Loonee Laai Jalaai Rahasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He makes leaves out of it and using chemicals washes it happily.

lines.gurmukhi: bwrh vMnI hoiekY lgY lvY ksautI ksY
lines.transliteration_english: Baarah Vannee Hoi Kai Lagai Lavai Kasaoutee Kasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then transformed into pure gold it becomes nimble and worthy of the test by touchstone.

lines.gurmukhi: tkswlY iskw pvY Gx Ahrix ivic Aclu srsY
lines.transliteration_english: Takasaalai Sikaa Pavai Ghan Aharani Vichi Achalu Sarasai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Now in the mint, it is moulded into a coin and remains happy on the anvil even under the strokes of hammer.

lines.gurmukhi: swlu suneIAw poqY psY ]12]
lines.transliteration_english: Saalu Sounaeeaa Potai Pasai ?12?

Shabad OS B.translation: Then becoming pure muhar, a gold coin, it gets deposited into treasury i.e.the gold which was in the dust particles because of its humility, ultimately turns out to be a coin of the treasure house.

lines.gurmukhi: 13 ^S^wS dwxw

Shabad OS B.translation: The poppy seed

lines.gurmukhi: KsKs dwxw hoie kY Kwk AMdir hoie Kwk smwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Khasakhas Daanaa Hoi Kai Khaak Andari Hoi Khaak Samaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Mixing with dust the poppy seed becomes one with dust.

lines.gurmukhi: dosqu posq bUt hoie rMg ibrMgI Pul iKVwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Dosatu Posatu Bootu Hoi Rang Birangee Phul Khirhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Becoming lovely poppy plant it blossoms with variegated flowers.

lines.gurmukhi: hofw hofI fofIAw iek dUM iek cVHwau cVHwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Hodaa Hodee Dodeeaa Ik Doon Ik Charhhaau Charhhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Its flower buds vie with one another to look beautiful.

lines.gurmukhi: sUlI aupir Kylxw ipCoN dy isir CqR DrwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Soolee Oupari Khaylanaa Pichhon Day Siri Chhatr Dharaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: First that poppy suffers on a long thorn but afterwards becoming circular assumes the shape of canopy.

lines.gurmukhi: cuKu cuKu hoie mlwiekY lohU pwxI rMig rMgwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Choukhu Choukhu Hoi Malaai Kai Lohoo Paanee Rangi Rangaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Getting sliced it oozes its sap of the colour of blood.

lines.gurmukhi: iprm ipAwlw mjlsI jog Bog sMjog bxwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Piram Piaalaa Majalasee Jog Bhog Sanjog Banaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Then in the parties, becoming the cup of love, it becomes the cause of joining of bhog, enjoyment, with the yoga.

lines.gurmukhi: AmlI hoie su mjls AwvY ]13]
lines.transliteration_english: Amalee Hoi Su Majalas Aavai ?13?

Shabad OS B.translation: Its addicts come to parties to sip it.

lines.gurmukhi: 14 kmwd

Shabad OS B.translation: Sugarcane

lines.gurmukhi: rs BirAw rsu rKdw bolx Axbolx ABirTw
lines.transliteration_english: Ras Bhariaa Rasu Rakhadaa Bolan Anoubolan Abhiritdaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Full of juice (sugarcane) is tasty and whether it speaks or not, in both the conditions, it is sweet.

lines.gurmukhi: suixAw AxsuixAw krY kry vIcwir ifTw AxifTw
lines.transliteration_english: Souniaa Anasouniaa Karai Karay Veechaari Ditdaa Anaditdaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: It listens not to what is said and sees not what is visible, i.e. in the sugarcane field one neither can listen to other nor a person  is visible in it.

lines.gurmukhi: AKI DUV AtweIAw AKI ivic AMgUr bihTw
lines.transliteration_english: Akhee Dhoorhi Ataaeeaa Akhee Vichi Angooru Bahitdaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: When in the form of seed the nodes of sugarcane are put into the earth, they sprout up.

lines.gurmukhi: iekdU bwhly bUt hoie isr qlvwieAw ieThu ieTw
lines.transliteration_english: Ik Doo Baahalay Boot Hoi Sir Talavaaiaa Itdahu Itdaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: From one sugarcane grow many a plant, each lovely from top to bottom.

lines.gurmukhi: duhu KuMFw ivic pIVIAY toty lwhy iequ guix imTw
lines.transliteration_english: Duhu Khounddhaa Vichi Peerheeai Totay Laahay Itu Gouni Mitdaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: It is crushed between two cylinderical rollers because of its sweet juice.

lines.gurmukhi: vIh iekIh vrqdw AvguixAwry pwp pixTw
lines.transliteration_english: Veeh Ikeeh Varatadaa Avagouniaaray Paap Panitdaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Worthy people use it on auspicious days whereas the wicked also use it (by preparing wine etc out of it) and get perished.

lines.gurmukhi: mMnY gMnY vwNgu suiDTw ]14]
lines.transliteration_english: Mannai Gannai Vaang Sudhitdaa ?14?

Shabad OS B.translation: Those who cultivated the nature of sugarcane i.e. do not  shed sweetness though in peril, are indeed steadfast persons.

lines.gurmukhi: 15 sÃwNqI bUMd qy is`p

Shabad OS B.translation: The svati drop and the shell

lines.gurmukhi: Gxhr bUMd suhwvxI nIvI hoie Agwshu AwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Ghanahar Boond Suhaavanee Neevee Hoi Agaasahu Aavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: A lovely drop of cloud falls from the sky and mitigating its ego goes into  the mouth of a shell in sea.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpu gvwie smuMdu vyiK ispY dy muh ivic smwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Aapu Gavaai Samoundu Vaykhi Sipai Day Muhi Vichi Samaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The shell, at once, closing its mouth dives down and hides itself in the underworld.

lines.gurmukhi: lYdo hI muih bUMd ispu cuMBI mwir pqwil lukwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Laido Hee Muhi Boond Sipu Chounbhee Maari Pataali Loukaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The shell, at once, closing its mouth dives down and hides itself in the underworld.

lines.gurmukhi: PiV kFY mrujIvVw pr kwrj no Awpu PVwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Dharhi Kaddhai Marujeevarhaa Par Kaaraj No Aapu Dharhaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The diver catches hold of it and it  also allows itself to be caught for the sale of altruistic sense.

lines.gurmukhi: prvis praupkwr no pr hiQ pQr dMd BnwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Paravasi Paraoupakaar No Par Hadi Padar Dand Bhanaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Controlled by  the sense of benevolence it gets itself broken on stone.

lines.gurmukhi: Buil ABuil Amulu dy moqI dwn n pCoqwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Bhuli Abhuli Amulu Day Motee Daan N Pachhotaavai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Knowing well or  unknowingly it bestows a free gift and never repents.

lines.gurmukhi: sPl jnmu koeI vruswvY ]15]
lines.transliteration_english: Saphal Janamu Koee Varousaavai ?15?

Shabad OS B.translation: Any rare one gets  such a blest life.

lines.gurmukhi: 16 hIrw kxI qoN is`K gurU dw myl

Shabad OS B.translation: Diamond-bit and Sikh of the Guru

lines.gurmukhi: hIry hIrw byDIAY brmy kxI AxI hoie hIrY
lines.transliteration_english: Heeray Heeraa Baydheeai Baramay Kanee Anee Hoi Heerai.

Shabad OS B.translation: With diamond-bit of drill the piece of diamond is cut gradually i.e. with the  diamond bit of the Word of the Guru the mind-diamond is pierced.

lines.gurmukhi: Dwgw hoie proeIAY hIrY mwl rswl ghIrY
lines.transliteration_english: Dhaagaa Hoi Paroeeai Heerai Maal Rasaal Gaheerai.

Shabad OS B.translation: With  the thread (of love) a beautiful string of diamonds is prepared.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq guru sbd ilv haumY mwir mrY mnu DIrY
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Guru Sabad Liv Haoumai Maari Marai Manu Dheerai.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the holy  congregation, merging consciousness in the Word and eschewing ego, the  mind is tranquilized.

lines.gurmukhi: mn ijix mnu dy ley mnu guix ivic gux gurmuiK srIrY
lines.transliteration_english: Man Jini Manu Day Laay Man Gouni Vichi Goun Guramoukhi Sareerai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Conquering the mind, one should surrender it (before the Guru) and adopt the virtues of gurmukhs, the Guru oriented ones.

lines.gurmukhi: pYrI pY pwKwku hoie kwmDynu sMqryxu n nIrY
lines.transliteration_english: Pairee Pai Paa Khaaku Hoi Kaamadhaynu Sant Raynu N Neerai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He  ought to fall on the feet of saints because even the wish-granting cow  (Kamadhenu) is not equal to the dust of the feet of saints.

lines.gurmukhi: islw AlUxI ctxI lK AMmiRq rs qrsn sIrY
lines.transliteration_english: Silaa Aloonee Chatanee Lakh Anmrit Ras Tarasan Seerai.

Shabad OS B.translation: This act is  nothing but licking of the tasteless stone though myriad tastes of sweet  juices one strives for.

lines.gurmukhi: ivrlw isK suxY gur pIrY ]16]
lines.transliteration_english: Viralaa Sikh Sounai Gur Peerai ?16?

Shabad OS B.translation: Rare is the Sikh who listens to (and accepts) the  teachings of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: 17 jIvn mukiq dI krnI

Shabad OS B.translation: The conduct of the liberated one

lines.gurmukhi: gur isKI gur isK sux AMdir isAwxw bwhir Bolw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikhee Gur Sikh Souni Andari Siaanaa Baahari Bholaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Listening to the teachings of the Guru, the Sikh becomes wise internally though apparently he looks a simpleton.

lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq swvDwn hoie ivxu gur sbd n suxeI bolw
lines.transliteration_english: Sabadi Surati Saavadhaan Hoi Vinu Gur Sabadi N Sounaee Bolaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He with full care keeps his  consciousness attuned to the Word and listens to nothing except the words  of Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur drsnu dyKxw swDsMgiq ivxu AMnHw Kolw
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Darasanu Daykhanaa Saadhasangati Vinu Annhaa Kholaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He beholds the true Guru and without the company of the saints  feels himself blind and deaf.

lines.gurmukhi: vwihgurU guru sbdu lY iprm ipAwlw cuip cbolw
lines.transliteration_english: Vaahaguroo Guru Sabadu Lai Piram Piaalaa Choupi Chabolaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Guru's word he receives is Vahiguru, the  wondrous Lord, and remains silently immersed in delight.

lines.gurmukhi: pYrI pY pwKwk hoie crix Doie crxodk Jolw
lines.transliteration_english: Pairee Pai Paa Khaak Hoi Charani Dhoi Charanodak Jholaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He bows on the  feet and becoming (humble) like dust goes on quaffing the nectar of the feet  (of the Lord).

lines.gurmukhi: crx kvl icqu Bvru kir Bvjl AMdir rhY inrolw
lines.transliteration_english: Charan Kaval Chitu Bhavaru Kari Bhavajal Andari Rahai Nirolaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He remains involved like black bee in the lotus feet (of the  Guru) and thus living in this world ocean remains unsmeared (by its water  and dust).

lines.gurmukhi: jIvix mukiq scwvw colw ]17]
lines.transliteration_english: Jeevani Moukati Sachaavaa Cholaa ?17?

Shabad OS B.translation: His is life of a liberated one during the life on earth i.e. he is a  jivanmukt'.

lines.gurmukhi: 18 vwl dw diRStwq

Shabad OS B.translation: Example of hair

lines.gurmukhi: isir ivic inky vwl hoie swD crx cvr kir FwlY
lines.transliteration_english: Siri Vichi Nikai Vaal Hoi Saadhoo Charan Chavar Kari Ddhaalai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Preparing the whisk of even the hair of one's head (the gurmukh) one should  wave it on the feet of the saints i.e. he should be extremely humble.

lines.gurmukhi: gursr qIrQ nwiekY AMJU Bir Bir pYr pKwlY
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sar Teerad Naai Kai Anjhoo Bhari Bhari Pairi Pakhaalai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Bathing  in the pilgrimage place, he should wash the feet of the Guru with tears of  love.

lines.gurmukhi: kwlI hUM Dauly kry clxw jwix nIswxu smHwlY
lines.transliteration_english: Kaalee Hoon Dhaulay Karay Chalanaa Jaani Neesaanu Samhaalai.

Shabad OS B.translation: From black, his hair may turn grey but then considering his time to  go (from this world) he should cherish in his heart the symbol (love) of the  Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: pYrI pY pwKwk hoie pUrw siqguru ndir inhwlY
lines.transliteration_english: Pairee Pai Paa Khaak Hoi Pooraa Satiguru Nadari Nihaalai.

Shabad OS B.translation: When one, falling at the Guru's feet, becomes dust himself, i.e. totally deletes ego from his mind, the true Guru also then blesses and obliges  him.

lines.gurmukhi: kwg kumMqhuM prm hMsu aujl moqI Kwie KvwlY
lines.transliteration_english: Kaag Koumantahoun Param Hansu Ujal Motee Khaai Khavaalai.

Shabad OS B.translation: He should become swan and leave black wisdom of crow and should  himself perform and get others perform pearl-like invaluable deeds.

lines.gurmukhi: vwlhu inkI AwKIAY gur isKI suix gurisK pwlY
lines.transliteration_english: Vaalahu Nikee Aakheeai Gur Sikhee Souni Gurasikh Paalai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The  teachings of the Guru are subtler even than the hair itself; the Sikh should  always follow them.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisKu lMGY iprm ipAwlY ]18]
lines.transliteration_english: Gurasikhu Laghai Piram Piaalai ?18?

Shabad OS B.translation: The Sikhs of the Guru go across the world-ocean by  virtue of their cup full of love.

lines.gurmukhi: 19 gu`lr dw diRStwNq

Shabad OS B.translation: Example of a wild fig tree

lines.gurmukhi: gulr AMdir Buxhxw gulr noN bHmMf vKwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Gular Andari Bhounahanaa Gular Non Brahamandu Vakhaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Fig is the cosmos for the insect living in it.

lines.gurmukhi: gulr lgix lK Pl iekdU lK AlK n jwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Gular Lagani Lakh Phal Ik Doo Lakh Alakh N Jaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: But on tree grow millions of  fruits which multiply further in numberless quantity.

lines.gurmukhi: lK lK ibrK bgIicAhu lK bgIcy bwg vKwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Lakh Birakh Bageechiahu Lakh Bageechay Baag Babaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gardens are there of  myriad trees and likewise are millions of gardens in the world.

lines.gurmukhi: lK bwg bHmMf ivic lK bHmMf lUA ivic AwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Baag Brahamand Vichi Lakh Brahamand Looa Vichi Aanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Millions of  universes are there in one small hair of God.

lines.gurmukhi: imhir kry jy imhrvwnu gurmuiK swDsMgiq rMgu mwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Mihari Karay Jay Miharavaanu Guramoukhi Saadhasangati Rangu Maanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: If that kind God showers His  grace, only then a gurmukh can enjoy the delight of the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: pYrI pY pwKwku hoie swihbu dy clY Ehu BwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Pairee Pai Paa Khaaku Hoi Saahibu Day Chalai Aohu Bhaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Only then falling on the feet and becoming dust, the humble one can mould  himself according to the divine Will (hukam) of the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: haumY jwie q jwie is\\\\wxY ]19]
lines.transliteration_english: Haoumai Jaai T Jaai Siaanai ?19?

Shabad OS B.translation: Only when ego is  erased, this fact is realized and identified.

lines.gurmukhi: 20 dUj dy cMd QoN aupdyS

Shabad OS B.translation: Lesson from moon of the second phase

lines.gurmukhi: duie idih cMdu Alopu hoie qIAY idh cVHdw hoie inkw
lines.transliteration_english: Dui Dihi Chandu Alopu Hoi Teeai Dih Charhhadaa Hoi Nikaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Remaining invisible for two days, third day the moon is beholden in a small  size.

lines.gurmukhi: auiT auiT jgqu juhwrdw ggn mhysur msqik itkw
lines.transliteration_english: Outdi Outdi Jagatu Juhaaradaa Gagan Mahaysur Masataki Tikaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Supposed to adorn the forehead of Mahesa, people bow to it again  and again.

lines.gurmukhi: solh klw sMGwrIAY sPl jnmu sohY kl iekw
lines.transliteration_english: Solah Kalaa Sanghaareeai Saphalu Janamu Sohai Kali Ikaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: When it has attained all the sixteen phases i.e. on the full moon  night it begins diminishing and again reaches the position of the first day. People now bow before it.

lines.gurmukhi: AMmiRq ikrix suhwvxI inJru JrY isMjY shiskw
lines.transliteration_english: Anmrit Kirani Suhaavanee Nijharu Jharai Sinjai Sahasikaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Nectar is sprinkled by its rays and it irrigates  all thirsty trees and fields.

lines.gurmukhi: sIql swNiq sMqoKu dy shj sMjogI rqn Aimkw
lines.transliteration_english: Seetalu Saanti Santokhu Day Sahaj Sajogee Ratan Amikaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Peace, contentment and cool, these invaluable  jewels are bestowed by it.

lines.gurmukhi: krY Anyrhu cwnxw for ckor iDAwnu Dir iCkw
lines.transliteration_english: Karai Anayrahu Chaananaa Dor Chakor Dhiaanu Dhari Chhikaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In darkness, it spreads light and provides the  thread of meditation to the chakor, the redlegged partridge.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpu gvwie Amol mixkw ]20]
lines.transliteration_english: Aapu Gavaai Amol Manikaa ?20?

Shabad OS B.translation: Only by erasing  its ego it becomes an invaluable jewel.

lines.gurmukhi: 21 DRU Bgq dw diRStwNq

Shabad OS B.translation: Dhruv, the humble one

lines.gurmukhi: hoie inmwxw Bgiq kir gurmuiK DRU hir drsnu pwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Hoi Nimaanaa Bhagati Kari Guramoukhi Dhr Hari Darasanu Paaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: By becoming humble only, Dhru could behold the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: Bgiq vClu hoie ByitAw mwxu inmwxy Awp idvwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Bhagati Vachhalu Hoi Bhaytiaa Maanu Nimaanay Aapi Divaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: God, affectionate  to the devotees, also embraced him and egoless Dhruv attained the highest  glory.

lines.gurmukhi: mwq lok ivic mukiq kir inhclu vwsu Agwis cVwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Maat Lok Vichi Moukati Kari Nihachalu Vaasu Agaasi Charhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In this mortal world he was granted liberation and then a stable  place in the sky was given him.

lines.gurmukhi: cMd sUrj qyiqs kroiV prdKxw cauPyir iPrwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Chand Sooraj Taytis Karorhi Paradakhanaa Chaudhayri Dhiraaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Moon, sun and all the thirty three crores of angels circumambulate and revolve around him.

lines.gurmukhi: vyd purwx vKwxdy prgtu kir prqwpu jxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Vayd Puraan Vakhaanaday Paragatu Kari Parataapu Janaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: His magnificence has  been clearly described in the Vedas and Puranas.

lines.gurmukhi: Aibgiq giq Aiq Agm hY AkQ kQw vIcwru n AwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Abigati Gati Ati Agam Hai Akad Kadaa Veechaaru N Aaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The story of that  unmanifest Lord is extremely mystical, indescribable and beyond all  thoughts.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu AlK lKwieAw ]21]4]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Alakhu Lakhaaiaa ?21?4?

Shabad OS B.translation: Only gurmukhs can have a glimpse of Him.

lines.gurmukhi: <> siqgur pRswid ]
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: AMmiRq diRsit invws AMmiRq bcn Anhd sbd
lines.transliteration_english: Anmrit Drisati Nivaasa , Anmrit Bachan Anahad Sabad ?

Shabad OS B.translation: n the divine glimpse of Guru Amar Das dwells the elixir of life. (On whomsoever he casts his look, he makes him immortal). His elixir-like words are like unstruck music.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur Amr pRgws imil AMmiRq AMmiRq Bey ]1]4]
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Amar Pragaasa , Mili Anmrit Anmrit Bhaay ?1?4?

Shabad OS B.translation: Resplendent True Guru Amar Das Ji became elixir-like after meeting Guru Angad Dev Ji. He now makes others calm and mortal.

lines.gurmukhi: AMmiRq bcn Anhd sbd AMmiRq diRsit invws
lines.transliteration_english: Anmrit Bachan Anahad Sabada , Anmrit Drisati Nivaas ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Meditating on unstruck melodious Divine Word, the sight and utterances of Guru Amar Das Ji, started showering elixir of life.

lines.gurmukhi: imil AMmiRq AMmiRq Bey siqgur Amr pRgws ]2]4]
lines.transliteration_english: Mili Anmrit Anmrit Bhaay , Satigur Amar Pragaas ?2?4?

Shabad OS B.translation: Meeting Guru Angad Dev Ji, elixir-like cool, tranquil and granter of emancipation, Satgur Amar Das too became the same.

lines.gurmukhi: siqgur Amr pRgws qws crnwmRq pwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Satigur Amar Pragaasa , Taas Charanaamrat Paavai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Satgur Amar Das Ji who is light refulgent, whosoever partakes nectar-like wash of his feet,

lines.gurmukhi: kwm nwm inihkwm prmpd shj smwvY
lines.transliteration_english: Kaam Naam Nihikaama , Paramapad Sahaj Samaavai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Becomes free from all desires is absorbed in high state of spirituality and equipoise.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK sMiD sugMD swD sMgiq inj Awsn
lines.transliteration_english: Gurmukhi Sandhi Sougandha , Saadh Sangati Nij Aasan ?

Shabad OS B.translation: By the fragrance of Naam Simran of Guru Amar Das Ji, the Guru's obedient seeker finds stability in the company of holy men and Lord's devotees

lines.gurmukhi: AMmiRq diRsit invws AMmiRq muK bcn pRgwsn ]3]4]
lines.transliteration_english: Anmrit Drisati Nivaasa , Anmrit Moukh Bachan Pragaasan ?3?4?

Shabad OS B.translation: In the elixir-like vision of Guru Amar Das lies the nectar of life and his words provide elixir-like luminance of Naam of the Lord. (4)
